controller

Interface CodeListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Controller

    public interface CodeListener
    CodeListener is an interface for classes that need to handle scene transitions, and events.
    Author:
    Miguel Fuentes, Devon Pirestani
    See Also:
    Code

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void codeEmitted(Code c)
      This method will handle each code emitted individually.
      void estuaryPopup(Animal a)
      This method will cause a popup to appear showing that the Animal a is the animal to be caught.
      void researchPopup(Animal a)
      This method will cause a popup to appear showing the data of Animal a.
      void tutorialPopup1()
      This method will cause the first tutorialPopup to appear at the game's start.
      void tutorialPopup2()
      This method will cause the second tutorialPopup to appear at the researchScreen

    • Method Detail

      • codeEmitted

        void codeEmitted(Code c)
        This method will handle each code emitted individually.
        Parameters:
        c - The Code to Emit.

      • estuaryPopup

        void estuaryPopup(Animal a)
        This method will cause a popup to appear showing that the Animal a is the animal to be caught.
        Parameters:
        a - The animal to appear in the popup

      • researchPopup

        void researchPopup(Animal a)
        This method will cause a popup to appear showing the data of Animal a.
        Parameters:
        a - The animal to appear in the popup

      • tutorialPopup1

        void tutorialPopup1()
        This method will cause the first tutorialPopup to appear at the game's start.

      • tutorialPopup2

        void tutorialPopup2()
        This method will cause the second tutorialPopup to appear at the researchScreen
